page.title: 19THE BARON OF BUCHLYVIE
page.content: {THE BARON OF BUCHLYVIE}was the name given to a famous CLYDESDALE STALLION owned by William McKeish of WOODEND FARM, BUCHLYVIE.The horse was foaled in{1900}and in{1902}was sold to Messrs. Kilpatrick and Dunbar of ABERDEEN. The BARON of BUCHLYVIE was to become sire to many prize winning horses which were exported to every corner of the world. His two joint owners each claimed sole rights to the horse until, as the result of a lawsuit, he was finally sold for the sum of{9500 guineas}(the highest price ever paid for a farm horse) at AYR in December,{1911}and the money divided between the two protagonists. In{1913}his leg was broken by a mare and the famous BARON OF BUCHLYVIE had to be destroyed. The skeleton of this fine animal can be seen today in{THE {KELVINGROVE MUSEUM, GLASGOW.}
